sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &app; application enables you to look up an online dictionary for definitions and correct spellings of words.

sect2.title: To Start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para: Choose AccessoriesDictionary.
Type gnome-dictionary -a, then press Return.

To add the GDict applet to a panel, right-click on the panel, then choose
Add to Panel Accessories Dictionary Lookup .
To start the &app; application, click on the applet icon.

note.para: If your computer is behind a firewall, you might need to use the SOCKS protocol to access the dictionary server and run the application successfully. Contact your system administrator for more information.

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app; main window. Contains titlebar, menubar, Word text box, and Look Up Word button.

sect2.para: The &app; window consists of the following elements:

listitem.para: Contains standard menus.
Use this field to enter the word that you want to look up in the dictionary.
Click on this button to look up the definition of the word in the Word field.
&app; displays the definition of a word in this area of the window.

sect2.title: To Look Up the Definition of a Word
sect2.para: To look up the definition of a word, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Type the word that you want to look up in the Word text box.
Click Look Up Word. &app; performs one of the following actions:
If &app; finds a definition for the word, the application displays the definition in the display area.

If &app; does not find a definition for the word, the application opens the Spell checker dialog and checks the spelling of the word. You can select a word in the Spell checker dialog, then click Look Up Word.
Use the scrollbar to scroll through the definition.

sect2.title: To Check the Spelling of a Word
sect2.para: To check the spelling of a word, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose DictionaryCheck Spelling .
In the Word text box of the Spell checker dialog, type the word that you want to check.
Select the Search Strategy that you want to use.
Click Spell. &app; displays correct spellings for the word in the display area.
Use the scrollbar to scroll through the spellings.

To look up the definition of a word that is displayed in the display area, select the word, then click Look Up Word. The application displays the dictionary definition in the display area of the Dictionary dialog.

sect2.title: To Clear the Display Area
sect2.para: To clear the display area of the Dictionary dialog, choose Edit Clear.

sect2.title: To Copy Text to Another Application
sect2.para: To copy the text in the display area to another application, perform one of the following tasks:

listitem.para: To copy all of the text, choose EditSelect All, then choose EditCopy.
To copy some of the text, select the lines that you want to copy, then choose EditCopy.

sect2.title: To Find Text in the Display Area
sect2.para: To find text in the display area, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose Edit Find. &app; displays a Find text box in the statusbar.
Type the string that you want to find in the Find text box, then press Return. You cannot use wildcards.
To find the next occurrence of the word, choose Edit Find Again.
Use this text box to specify the online server that &app; accesses. Click Default to revert to the default setting.
Default: dict.org.
Use this text box to specify the port number that &app; uses to access the dictionary server. Click Default to revert to the default setting.
Default: 2628.
Information about this option will be available in a future release of the manual.
Default: selected.
When &app; accesses the dictionary server, &app; downloads a list of the dictionary databases that are available. Use this drop-down list box to select the databases that you want to use.
Default: Search all databases.

When &app; accesses the dictionary server, &app; downloads a list of the search strategies that are available on the server. Use this drop-down list box to select the search strategy that you want to use.
Default: Match words within Levenshtein distance one.
